title: How many societies to join?
author: Lavya Thapar
content: >Entering into the college life with an energetic mindset, students get over-exicited to join lots of societies.Later on due to increase academic stress, when they leave or become inactive in many of them, it imposes a bad impression.So how many societies should a student join and what must be the decision criteria?

answers.content:
#Chosing on the basis of interest

 The decision of choosing a particular society largely depends on your interest.What have you been actively participating in from your school life? Things that you excel at and that can grab you a lot of certificates and prizes?This would be the most comfortable option to go with.Whatever domain you want to select, you name it and there is a high chance you will find a society emphasising on that.
answers.author: Author B

replies.author: Auhtor A
replies.content: Seems like a good and effective option. Thankyou!

answers.content:
#Acquiring new skill set

 Another option that you can consider is if there is a spark inside you to have a new skill set and are ready to improve upon things that you are afraid of.Suppose you have always had ***stage fright*** and lack of confidence speaking to large group of people A debating society thus would be the best option to go to.Being an active member there would take out that fea and might give you a lot of competition experience.
answers.author: Author B

title: Should I make notes?
author: Manikya Sharma
content: >As far as I have seen, most of the teachers take their lectures through slideshows and ppts.They provide them later on to the students.Thus, i see no point in making notes.Suggest if my thinking is right or wrong?

answers.content: As far as i have experienced, that making notes has always helped me during the exam times.Sometimes the crucial conetnt does not lie within the slideshows r pdfs but what the teacher is explaining by his words. Noting down those points would give an upper edge to solve tricky questions if they appear in exams.
answers.author: Lavya Thapar

replies.content: Very true. That was one area where i did not ponder upon so much. Thankyou for making me realise that.
replies.author: Manikya Sharma

title: How to balance enjoyment and studies?
author: Nikhil Sharma
content: >I am currently a third semester student.In my first semester,I was pretty relaxed and did not give much attention on studies(trying to relive the JEE stress).As a result i did not get a good SGPA. Later i realised the importance of SGPA after interacting with my seniors and studied dedicatedly. I scored a good SGPA in the second semester but realised that those 3 months did not have any relaxation.So how can i balance studies with enjoyment?

answers.author: Author A
answers.content: I read an article regarding the same and got an interesting solution called as the 8-8-8 rule. It says you to have 8 hours of sleep, 8 hours of study and 8 hours of enjoyment and other stuff.Try adapting this by making a schedule following the same.

replies.author: Nikhil Sharma
replies.content: Thats a pretty impressive strategy. Thank you, I will try implementing this.
